questiontext.text:
Exercise

Obtain the Fourier series of \[ f(t) = \lvert t \rvert \hspace{1cm} \pi \leq t \leq \pi \hspace{1cm} f(t + 2\pi) = f(t) \] and use it to calculate the summation \( \displaystyle{\sum _{n = 1}^\infty }\dfrac{1}{(2n - 1)^2} \) by putting \( t = 0\).

\( \displaystyle{ \sum _{n = 1}^\infty } \dfrac{1}{(2n - 1)^2} = \) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]][[feedback:prt1]]

generalfeedback.text: As \( f(t) \) is an even function, \( b_n = 0 \). For \( a_0\) we have \[ \begin{align} a_0 &= \dfrac{1}{\pi} \displaystyle{ \int _{-\pi}^\pi } \lvert t \rvert \hspace{0.1cm} dt \\ &= \dfrac{1}{\pi} \displaystyle{ \int _{-\pi}^0 } -t \hspace{0.1cm} dt + \dfrac{1}{\pi} \displaystyle{ \int _{0}^\pi } t \hspace{0.1cm} dt \\ &= \pi \end{align} \] By using integration by parts, we then find \[ \begin{align} a_n &= \dfrac{1}{\pi} \displaystyle{ \int _{-\pi}^\pi } \lvert t \rvert \cos nt \hspace{0.1cm} dt \\ &= \dfrac{1}{\pi} \displaystyle{ \int _{-\pi}^0 } - t \cos nt \hspace{0.1cm} dt + \dfrac{1}{\pi} \displaystyle{ \int _{0}^\pi } t \cos nt \hspace{0.1cm} dt \\ &= \dfrac{1}{\pi} \left( \left[ -\dfrac{t}{n} \sin nt \right]_{-\pi}^0 + \dfrac{1}{n} \displaystyle{ \int _{-\pi}^0 } \sin nt \hspace{0.1cm} dt + \left[ \dfrac{t}{n} \sin nt \right]_{0}^\pi - \dfrac{1}{n} \displaystyle{ \int _{0}^\pi } \sin nt \hspace{0.1cm} dt \right) \\ &= \dfrac{1}{\pi} \left( \left[ - \dfrac{1}{n^2} \cos nt \right]_{-\pi}^0 + \left[ \dfrac{1}{n^2} \cos nt \right]_{0}^\pi \right) \\ &= \dfrac{2}{n^2 \pi} \left( \cos n\pi - 1 \right) \end{align} \] \[ = \begin{cases} 0 \hspace{1cm} n = 2, 4, 6, \dots \\ -\dfrac{4}{n^2 \pi} \hspace{1cm} n = 1, 3, 5, \dots \end{cases} \] Now rewriting \(n\) to take the form of an odd number as \( 2n - 1\) (where \(n = 1, 2, 3, 4, \dots\)), we have the Fourier series \[ f(t) = \dfrac{\pi}{2} + \sum _{n=1}^\infty \dfrac{-4}{(2n-1)^2\pi} \cos \left[ (2n - 1)t \right] \] Now setting \(t = 0\) we have \(f(t) = 0\), and therefore \[ 0 = \dfrac{\pi}{2} + \sum _{n=1}^\infty \dfrac{-4}{(2n-1)^2\pi} \] which can be rearranged to give \[ \sum _{n=1}^\infty \dfrac{1}{(2n-1)^2} = \dfrac{\pi^2}{8} \]
